page.title: 03EDGEFIELD PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The most interesting building in Edgefield is the Church which was originally built half a mile away, where the thirteenth century octagonal tower still stands. When Canon Marcon became Rector in 1875 he found the old church in bad repair and decided to move it nearer to his parishioners. Most of the materials of the old building were re-used: the stones were marked so that they could be replaced correctly, but the old tower with 14th century belfry was left standing. The new church was consecrated in 1884. The octagonal font has a rare 13th century bowl.The screen in the south aisle has painted panels dated 1526, showing the donors with their seven sons and six daughters.The new tower was built in 1907. There are 18th century memorial tablets and one to Canon Marcon who died in 1937.
